author: {'steamid': '76561197995178354', 'num_games_owned': 2395, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1708618509}
review:
Mais uma vez mais um jogo da Alawar que merecia uma nota "meh" ou "mais ou menos". Este aqui mesmo tendo menos níveis demora bastante, sinceramente.

Os níveis finais, que deveriam ser mais difíceis para encerrar bem o jogo, são a mesma coisa de todos os outros. Nada demais.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086797272', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1707924937}
review:
[h1]Остров Невезения 3 [/h1]

Третья часть из серии МОАИ. Сохранен все тот же дух серии, что и в прошлых частях, но с небольшими изменениями/улучшениями.
После событий первых двух частей настал золотой век – папуасы жили и не тужили. Но недолго длилось счастье – демографический кризис заставил вас отправиться на соседний остров, дабы наладить торговлю необходимыми ресурсами для своего… племени?
С приезда на остров и начинается старт в этой части серии, что будет дальше – спойлерить не буду.

[i]Итак, что нам завезла новая часть:
1.)	Туториал – подробнейшее прохождения уровня, даже со скриншотами (уровней здесь 80 основных и 26 дополнительных, что-то типо ДЛС).
2.)	Новая ресурс – золото, новая добывающая постройка – золотая шахта.
3.)	Способности  - скорость, влиятельность, дипломатия – каждая по мере прокачки дает разные бонусы.
4.)	Достижения стали легче – чуть уменьшили условия для их получения.
5.)	Таймер – убрали на казуальном уровне сложности.
6.)	Новые бонусы на карте – перчатка (лутает ресы за вас автоматически) и вроде ещё что-то.
7.)	Переработали пекарню – теперь хлеб делается только за золотишко.
8.)	Статуи МОАИ теперь приносят ману – вместо отстрела призраков, которых кстати заменили обычные бандосы.
9.)	2 вида храмов – большой и маленький. Каждый приносит разное кол-во маны за одинаковое кол-во масла.
По основным изменениям вроде все. Графика осталась на том же уровне.
Просто хорошее продолжение серии, играется так же приятно, как и предыдущие части. [/i]

[b]9 моих любимых черепаховых шлемов из 10 [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198118421272', 'num_games_owned': 2790, 'num_reviews': 884, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1681989165}
review:
MOAI=摩艾=复活岛上立巨型摩艾石像的人
一个放弃对外部的开拓，转为内敛，塑造想象共同体的群体

他们最终的衰败和殖民者无关 
在1722年荷兰人到来前 就已垂垂欲死
可能当年砍伐全岛的巨木 不是用来挪动石像 
而是建造成波利尼西亚独木舟远赴南美 
结局会大不一样
令人唏嘘


回归游戏本体
玩法如下——
开局时[b]一定[/b]要选择 easy模式 这样取消了时间限制，只要通关就是全三星通关
然后就变成了一个没有时间限制的
时间管理游戏..

不需要规划 资源不够只需要等待
大概率全成就走起

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1665412270}
review: Moai 3: Trade Mission Collector's Edition, oyuncunun ana karakterlerin kaderini kontrol ettiği ve görevlerini tamamlamak için görsel olarak çarpıcı topraklarda seyahat ettikleri bir macera oyunudur. Oyunda tamamlanması gereken 100'den fazla seviye, büyüleyici ve komik bir hikaye ve özel Collector's Edition bonusları bulunmaktadır. Oyuncu, yok edilen köyleri yeniden inşa ederken, düşmanları yenerken ve topraktan hayatta kalırken kahramanları ve işçilerini kontrol etmek için akıllı zaman ve kaynak yönetimi stratejileri kullanmalıdır. Oyunda ayrıca devasa bir bonus bölüm, tamamlanacak alternatif seviyeler ve adım adım izlenecek yol, masaüstü duvar kağıtları ve indirilebilir bir film müziği gibi çok sayıda ekstra bulunuyor. Oyun saatlerce bağımlılık yaratan bir oynanış sunuyor ve oyuncular için harika bir macera olmaya hazırlanıyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298389127', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1627675369}
review: I enjoy these games, they are satisfying and comforting and numbing in a way. I often play them on bad days just to get out of my own head. My only issue with them is the whole "white saviour" idea, like I think I mentioned in my review of the first MOAI. It's really awful, but to be honest the story behind the game isn't as important as the mechanics when it comes to enjoyment, so I just roll my eyes at the white man saving the helpless natives trope and enjoy the fun gameplay.

review: Znacznie lepsza od pierwszej części. Mechanika dopracowana do perfekcji, graficznie cukierek. Nie traci swojego casualowego charakteru na poziomie standardowym (53 levele), a na trudnym  (drugie 53) wciąż są satysfakcjonujące wyzwania. Najlepszy time management na Steam. Wciąga jak bagno efektem "jeszcze jednego poziomu", a jest ich łącznie ponad 100.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1404, 'last_played': 1607775312}
review:
[h1]MOAI 3: Trade Mission Collector's Edition[/h1]
3/7 Sammelspiel von 2016

Es geht um ein gestohlenes Artefakt und sein Königreich samt seiner Bewohner. Durch geschicktes Zeit- und Rohstoffmanagement steuerst du den Helden und deine Arbeiter, während sie zerstörte Dörfer wieder aufbauen und Feinde besiegen. Außerdem lernt ihr, dass Zaubern eine ganz praktische Sache sein kann.

Das ist der Werbung entnommen. Ein paar Infos von mir dazu.
Du mußt vieles sammeln, Blockaden überwinden, Tauschen und Handeln, Geister bekämpfen, Gebäude bauen oder instand setzen und sehr viel Spaß haben. Dazu kommt noch eine interessante Geschichte. Mehr als 100 Level sind es in dieser Version.
Interessant gemachtes und gestalltetes Gameplay.

Wirklich gut gemacht, insbesondere der ausgewogene Schwierigkeitsgrad. Hervorragendes Spiel für zwischendurch.

[h1] MOAI 3: Trade Mission Collector's Edition [/h1]
3/7 collecting game from 2016

It's about a stolen artifact and its kingdom and its inhabitants. With skillful time and resource management, you control the hero and your workers as they rebuild destroyed villages and defeat enemies. You also learn that doing magic can be a very practical thing.

This is taken from advertising. Some information from me about it.
You have to collect a lot, overcome blockages, trade and trade, fight ghosts, build or repair buildings and have a lot of fun. There is also an interesting story. There are more than 100 levels in this version.
Interestingly made and designed gameplay.

Really well done, especially the balanced level of difficulty. Excellent game for in between.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027424772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1850, 'last_played': 1552251984}
review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

"MOAI: Trade Mission" Collector's Edition is a Strategy game. The game was developed by Toyman Interactive & Alawar Entertainment and published by Buka Entertainment.

"Trade Mission" the third episode of "MOAI." Previous episodes: "Build Your Dream" and "Path to Another World."

Since this is a collector's edition, it comes with extra features that are not available in its counterpart; the standard edition.

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention the visuals in the game are well done. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are two different difficulty game modes to choose from: Casual and Normal.

This is a strategy game, where careful planning is required, due to the limited amount of resources that are available.

There are building structures that generate resources but they need to be collected manually by the player.

There are special power up bonuses in-game that allows the player to complete the levels much quicker. The special power up bonuses does have a time limit attached to them. These special power up bonuses show up much later in the game.

The character's rank updates after earning a certain amount of points from playing the game.

There are twenty-four different relics to collect in the game. All artifacts are stored in the player's backpack. These artifacts can be equipped and they have different purposes in the game.

There are sixty-five different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Since this is a collector's edition, there are bonus levels, but they can be accessed only after the main levels are completed.

Miscellaneous

There are some extra features in the game: Bonus Levels; Wallpapers; Gallery; Music and Game's Strategy Guide. Most of these extra features can be accessed after the entire game is completed.

There are five different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its' Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. The replay value for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060034265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2195, 'last_played': 1596888544}
review:
This chapter in the MOAI saga is all of the same - a time management game
There are 40 levels in the main campaign and 13 extra ones. For each save the final level, there's an "extra" level that can be played as well. There are the usual achievements that we found in the serie. Note that to trigger them while playing, I started with a clean slate, user wise (deleted all profiles).

I found the balance, in this one, a bit confusing. The 10-15 first levels are quite difficult and I had to replay almost each of them to get the gold status - some several times. However, after that it becomes seemingly very easy. from level 30 and on, I triggered gold status at first try.

The only I have found is that there's no ambient music in the extra levels.

I'm playing this on Win7 64bit without any issue

author: {'steamid': '76561198031643168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1581874666}
review:
Ok, they got back on the right path. This edition of Moai hits 
all the marks, unlike #2. The levels are mostly challenging again 
just to get a Sun. No more multiple Suns. You either "beat" the level
or you don't. New twists with treasure items to enhance skills/abilities
of workers.
I like that you can go back to virtually the same level with different goals
to achieve. Fun and "challenging" again!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971047607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1199, 'last_played': 1509146172}
review:
MOAI 3: Trade Mission Collector's Edition is a time and resource management game that doesn't offer much new over the previous two titles. That said, the previous two games are pretty good for the genre, as is Moai 3. 
There are a few additions that don't add much to the gameplay, abilities (which are visually represented and passive .... and may not do anything at all!) and items, which you can equip from the main menu and these give you in-game bonuses.
The game felt as long as the previous titles, but there are an additional 20 levels under an easy to miss icon at the bottom of the main game once you have completed the main game.

Overall, if you like time and resource management games, you'll be happy with this one. Graphics and sound suit the theme, it doesn't take the genre in a new direction, and is a casual time-sink that takes few risks, but you'll find yourself wanting to gold all the levels anyhow!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098765263', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 2449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1548908984}
review:
Это третья часть казуальной стратегии.  Главный герой отправляется в опасное путешествие, чтобы вернуть похищенный артефакт и спасти свое поселение.
Игра состоит из 40 основных уровней и 38 дополнительных. Приятная глазу графика и милое музыкальное сопровождение не дадут вам заскучать. В игре имеются два уровня сложности: легкий и казуальный. Единственное, что отличает уровни сложности это лимит времени. Как и во второй части, у вас имеется рюкзак, в который вы складываете артефакты, найденные в путешествии. Они дают дополнительные бонусы – например, добывать больше дерева, камня или увеличивать скорость работы работников… Видно, что разработчики не стоят на месте и стремятся развивать игру. Появились домики лесорубов и золотые шахты. Это, на мой взгляд, упростило прохождение игры. В прошлой части в пекарнях хлеб просто размножался, в этой – нужно заплатить золото, чтобы испечь его. Золото можно получить, уничтожая бандитов, которые иногда нападают на ваше поселение. Неприятным открытием, по моему мнению, было то, что для уничтожения постройки необходимо было золото. Ещё одной новинкой стало то, что статуи теперь стали производить ману. А если произвести их улучшение, то можно вместе с маной получать дополнительно ресурс – еду, камень, дерево. 
В игре есть достижения, но они находятся внутри игры, в Steame их нет. Коллекционные карточки также имеются. Неприятный минус – отсутствие русского языка! 
Оценка 8/10
Наконец-то в Steam добавлены достижения и русский язык. Спасибо, разработчики!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498126', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 1796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1672225149}
review:
UPDATE:

Eigentlich ein gutes Spiel.

Da sich durch die ganze Serie eine äußerst bescheidenen Programmierung der Achievements zieht, werte ich das Spiel ab.
Entweder klappt etwas nicht, oder man kann alle 40 bis 80 Level evtl. sogar mehrmals neu spielen, weil man irgendwo etwas vergessen haben soll.
Es gibt keine Markierung der Level, ob dort wirtklich alle Ziele erreicht worden sind.
Die Entwickler lernen einfach nicht dazu.
Schämt euch!
Ich setze die Serie nun aug meine Igno-Liste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003030375', 'num_games_owned': 3129, 'num_reviews': 773, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1458214650}
review:
MOAI 3: Trade Mission Collector’s Edition:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   
Welcome back to the Island of Tapa-tui. I don’t know if you recall, but you are this hero who wanted to go around the world on his hot air balloon. . .  Remember, you crashed it on this lovely Island, you married the chieftain daughter, “Bright Light,” who you saved, and defeated “Miru” the leader of the underworld in the previous games. Now the population is expanding and all the Island resources are running low. The solution is to establish trade routes with your neighbours. However, it is not going to be as easy as you thought, especially as unexpected challenges arise quickly within your journey.

MOAI 3: Trade Mission Collector’s Edition is a Casual / strategy / resources and time management game. You will start the game on the Island of Tikku-ana. If you are familiar with the first 2 games, well you probably know the drill. You will control a minimum of 2 workers and give them orders - to collect food (pond or plate of fruits), remove road obstacles such as trees, rocks, fill big holes or open treasure chests. You will have to build farming fields (food resources), quarries (stone resources), sawmills (wood resources), gold mines (coin resources) and more. Each time you built, upgrade a structure or remove an obstacle it will cost you specific resource (s).  The aim is to achieve all tasks in each level before the time runs out. It can be tricky at times. 

When you open a treasure chest, you might get some well needed resources or artefacts, but you could also pick up some special abilities to help you finish the level on time. Something like the “Sandals of Speed” which will move your worker from one point another faster. However, it will be for a limited time. 

If you finish the level on time, you will score points and add whatever artefacts you found to your Backpack. Your hero can wear up to six artefacts and can gain an increasing percentage on the production of goods, speed and much more. 
The game has 100 levels and each time you beat a level, you can retry the same level on a higher difficulty.  If you are stuck on a level, don’t worry as the game as a strategy guide available for you if need be.
 
Cute and polished graphics. The controls are point and click and easy to master. I really like the fact that you hover over the resources to collect them rather than clicking on them one by one. It makes the game more enjoyable.

Positives:
~~~~~~~

-	Cute and polished graphics
-	Nice story-line
-	Fun and easy to play
-	Two difficulties per level
-	Stack of Achievements
-	Trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 
  
-	Repetitive

MOAI 3: Trade Mission Collector’s Edition is a very good strategy / resources and time management game. If you are a fan of the series, you would not be disappointed. If you have never played this type of game, MOAI 3 is a good choice to start with. Recommended!

8/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998116681', 'num_games_owned': 3146, 'num_reviews': 600, 'playtime_forever': 2371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1470081938}
review:
[Review key provided by publisher]

Time management (city-builder+puzzle type) casual game, with plot tied into previous series. Mechanics are mostly standard for the genre: workers, upgrades, artefacts (spells), equipment and superficial primary stats; though there is a enemy-clicker element on later levels, with superficial tower defence. Visuals are calm and pleasant; sound design is fitting, with a lot of audio cues for states of progression. Level design is nice — despite repetitive nature of the genre, tasks and maps feel distinct and diverse. Later ones are also somewhat frantic and challenging.
Game can be played in 4:3 but feels too much zoomed in. Native resolution in window is weird, but native aspect ratio seems to be nowadays common 16:9. So if you have 4:3 screen and can tolerate borders — i suggest you to play in windowed mode.

Story somewhat relies on player being already invested in the characters (this is my first game in the series) and overall is toothless and plain, reminiscent of old RTS games, though with interesting moai theme. Which, on the other hand, means that it was really easy to avoid mistakes in the narrative. Names and descriptions of difficulty levels did caught me off-guard and cracked me up rather hard. Also i like that they did choose to use statues with hats and eyes.
Bonus campaign takes place after trade mission returned home and adds 13+12 of new levels to the main campaign comprised of 40+38 levels, about pacifying the volcano and dealing with damage.

There are in-game achievements, which for some reason are not tied to steam. Mostly progression-based, resource accumulation and optional mission-based. But "coconut thrower" is misleading and actually means the bandits from end-game levels, rather than the usual bandits.

Trading cards feature characters from the game and have nice artwork; emoticons are utilitarian, some looks nice and fitting, while others are too small; profile backgrounds, on the other hand, are not very good, they are really blurry and it seems like they are pretty low-res.

Overall it's really solid game in the genre, more focused on mechanics, rather than on the heroes and some thorough story.

Немного раздражает то, что в игре от воронежской конторы нет возможности выбрать русский язык.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1455808011}
review:
This video features a non-biased quick look @ the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NHTIzFI-Cvg

The 3rd instalment of this cool resource management and collection franchise. The Hero and Bright Light return in an all-new adventure to reclaim a stolen artifact and crush a threat to their kingdom and their people. In the compelling and entertaining Moai 3: Trade Mission Collector's Edition, you control the fate of the main characters as they travel across visually stunning lands to complete their quest. Using clever time and resource management strategies, you will control the heroes and their workers as they rebuild decimated villages, defeat enemies, and survive off the land. They will also learn that a little magic along the way can make a big difference in the end. 
With the main quest, a colossal bonus chapter, and alternate levels to complete, Moai 3 offers hours upon hours of addictive gameplay. In addition, players can earn dozens of achievements, unlock useful bonus items, and access a multitude of extras, including a step-by-step walkthrough, desktop wallpapers, and a downloadable soundtrack! With all of this and more, Moai 3 is poised to be your next great adventure! - Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085995031', 'num_games_owned': 7977, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1454237102}
review:
whats up friends and foes? its me payde fore the clown here to blow your mind and empty your wallet with the help of another payde fore review!

for the uneducated, the moai are the famous stone figures found on easter island. i have been waiting my whole life for a game where i get the privilege of playing as the rapa nui people. tragically, it is believed that they spent so much of their time creating the stone monoliths that their entire society collapsed as a result. this is where you come in.

you, my friends, need to save the rapa nui from extinction. they are terrible at time management, and oh wow they are even worse at managing their resources.

a small investment of a meager $3usd will allow you to teach them right from wrong! only you can show them that farm animals can be used for food, not just for dressing up in silly costumes. instead of trading their wood for rocks, use your skills to help them trade for something better like the turtle shell helmet that makes them move faster! click click click! save bright eyes and little feather(the main characters) from being the chosen victims of the evening's human sacrifice! there is so much to do they need your help! i can't do it i am too drunk! throw your money at the screen and help them! i will pay you back, i promise!

thanks for reading another payde fore review. feel free to check out the new payde fore curations group at http://steamcommunity.com/groups/PAYDEFORE for more games that have payde fore approval!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001468649', 'num_games_owned': 9437, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1456995634}
review:
Moai 3: Trade Mission is management game. It is the third game from the Moai series, which is developed by Alawar Entertainment and Toyman Interactive. The game has two difficulties modes which makes the experience more enjoyable for both casual gamers and more experienced players of this genre. The graphics are nice and combined with the calming soundtrack makes for pleasant game sessions.

The game continues the story from the previous ones, now with our protagonists to travel to the neighbour island, Mata-fiki, to establish trading relationships with their neighbours. Like always the hero is helping everyone in need along it's way and after a bit of a plot twist at the end of the story he manages to fulfill his goal. For game mechanics, they are similar with the ones from the previous games, the improvement would be the adition of gold mine.

With Moai 3:Trade Mission the series got it's first collectors edition. The additions which come with it are a strategy guide, extra levels after you finish the story of the game, some wallpapers and the game soundtrack. 

As a side note, compared with the previous games from the series, this one doesn't have the steam achievements implemented, but has 58 in-game achievements.

[h1]Note - This game was reviewed using a key provided by the publisher.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198079335824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1626494255}
review:
[h1]MOAI 3: Trade Mission Collector's Edition[/h1]

[i] MOAI 3 is the 3rd installment of the series, with MOAI, and MOAI 2 being the other 2 games, by Alawar Entertainment. All these 3 games are point and click, resource, gathering, time management games, and each with a slightly differant story that progresses onto the next to follow, and they are really very interesting, fun and relaxing games to play. They are visually very appealing, stunning, very cute, colourful and very well designed. Im not so good with the timed part of the game, so I prefere to just play and enjoy at my own personal pace.[/i]

[i]The game comes as a Collectors Edition ONLY at this stage, and what you get is a Step by Step Walkthrough Guide, some Desktop Wallpapers, the full Downloadable Soundtrack and many other extras included. Who knows maybe the developer will give future options for those that dont want all the extras in this game title, and separate them, so you can just buy the game as a stand alone.[/i]

[i]The game also has [h1] 58 [/h1] in game Achievements, which would be much better if they where Steam Integrated so we can share with our friends, and show off our game percentage %, these are very much loved for achievement hunters, and I myself enjoy getting them as well ;D, so i hope these lovely developers can make them Steam achievements. [/i]

[i]The Game also comes with trading cards, emoticons and backgrounds, for those who love to collect them and craft the badges[/i]

[i] I feel the price is a fair and reasonable price for the game or you can wait for a better discount from a sale if you are short of cash, if you enjoy these game's very much please consider the work that has gone into these game's, including the walkthrough guide and the wonderful art, it does not disappoint and thats my oppinion whether I bought the game or not. [/i]

[h1] Special Note : Key was provided by the publisher, for a very nice and honest review and that is what I have provided to the best of my personal abillity and I really enjoy this game as well [/h1]

[i] Thank you greatly for producing, making and bringing this lovely game to life Alawar Entertainment ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999226694', 'num_games_owned': 1475, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1454275220}
review:
MOAI 3: Trade Mission – это продолжение серии классических тайм-менеджмент игр, посвящённых Вождю племени Тапа-Туи. В прошлый раз горе-путешественнику пришлось спасать свою возлюбленную из Подземного царства. Сейчас его целью является налаживание мирных отношений с соседним племенем, обосновавшемся на дивном тропическом острове.

Игровой процесс третьей части не претерпел сильных изменений: всё те же ресурсы, работники, визуальный стиль построек и персонажей. Игра не собирается меняться, совсем. Если вы играли в предыдущие части – здесь вы будете чувствовать себя комфортно. Из нового в игре: простенькая приключенческая история и красивые рисунки, являющиеся основным элементом повествования. Всё тот же отличный стиль оформления, что и раньше, выглядит всё очень красочно и сочно. Разве что некоторые постройки не очень хорошо вписываются в окружающий ландшафт. В отличии от, например, игры 12 Labours of Hercules, в ней всё выглядит более гармонично и умело, да и с каждой частью в игру привносятся новые механики, существенно влияющие на игровой процесс, чего не скажешь о серии MOAI. Но если вам было мало двух других игр серии – эта вас не разочарует. 

То, на сколько понравится игра, зависит от ваших ожиданий. Не играли в предыдущие и решили начать с третьей, хотите поиграть в достаточно сложный тайм-менеджмент с приятной визуальной частью – вы не будете разочарованы. Играли в две предыдущих игры и хотите чего-нибудь инновационного в плане геймплея? Увы, этого не найдёте. 

Если рассматривать конкретно данную игру, то можно смело утверждать, что она качественна и интересна. Игровой процесс предельно прост, можно расслабиться и спокойно покликать мышкой, если, конечно, играть на лёгком уровне сложности. Если же вы не ищете лёгких путей, тогда местный «Казуальный» уровень сложности заставит вас поднапрячься. Лимит времени – это единственное, что различает игру на разных сложностях. 

Как уже было сказано ранее, визуально игра выглядит отлично: качественно нарисованные забавные персонажи, простые на вид постройки, призванные добывать один из ресурсов, красочный интерфейс и, конечно же, приятные глазу пейзажи уровней. Единственное, что в оформлении уровней мне не понравилось – их размер: они ужасно маленькие и ограниченные, слишком «квадратные» и прямолинейные. Но в остальном, игра очень радует: каждый уровень выглядит по-разному, имеет свою уникальную цель и условия, что позволяет разнообразить игровой процесс. Красочная глобальная карта – отдельная тема, она выглядит просто чудесно. Некоторые её части очень аккуратно и эффектно анимированы, что придаёт ей некий шарм и оживляет её. В MOAI 3 есть одна очень необычная для тайм-менеджмент игр особенность – инвентарь персонажа. В некоторых миссиях у вас будет возможность завладеть особым артефактом, который в дальнейшем сможет использовать ваш герой. Спешу заметить, что бонусы от них очень полезны и могут оказать существенную помощь в прохождении некоторых уровней, которых здесь более тридцати. Музыка в игре приятная, не надоедает и гармонирует с визуальным рядом. Озвучки нет, все слова и фразы персонажей звучат по типу «Бубу? – Бубу!» Это забавно и иногда может вызвать непроизвольную улыбку.

Советую ли я эту игру? Безусловно, если вы любите расслабляющие, незамысловатые и интуитивно понятные игры, преимущественно в жанре тайм-менеджмент. Игра обязательно понравится всем, вне зависимости от возраста и пола: мамам-папам и их деткам, и даже бабушкам с дедушками, всё дело в незамысловатом игровом процессе и приятном визуальном исполнении.

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10680382/] Обзор составлен автором кураторской страницы - "Special Games Club"[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197999732661', 'num_games_owned': 1755, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1457219924}
review:
MOAI 3: Trade Mission is the third game in the successful time management series by Alawar Entertainment.  Although this installment does not have quite as many changes and improvements as the previous, it remains an enjoyable take on the genre that provides plenty of challenge for those who seek it, along with relaxing gameplay for the more casual-minded gamer.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=610511826
This time around, we follow Tapa-tui’s leader and Bright Light as they venture off island to neighboring Tikku-ana where they begin a new adventure together.  Gameplay is relatively the same, consisting of multi-tasking activities as efficiently as possible while managing resources to complete specific tasks (build, gather, trade, etc.) in an effort to beat the clock.  The only real change is the addition of gold mines which offer coins as a resource.  All of the other series improvements are present including the ability to equip items that offer specific perks and the secondary bonus objectives for each level with additional challenges to overcome.  Granted, the game plays the same as MOAI 2, but that didn’t bother me much as I felt they got the formula just about right with the previous installment. 

As the first Collector’s Edition in the series, we get a few neat extras including a Strategy Guide which gives helpful tips for each level if you find yourself struggling.  There’s also downloadable wallpapers and music tracks (something I’ve been awaiting for a while now), and additional levels available once you’ve completed the main story scenario. Unfortunately, there is no Steam integration for the achievements, which is a pretty big bummer.  But I hope this is remedied in the future as they really added value to the previous 2 titles.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=610511881
Honestly, I wish I could say more than I have, but MOAI 3 is essentially a continuation of MOAI 2’s story with the same great gameplay, but little more.  If you enjoyed the first two games, you will definitely enjoy MOAI 3.  However, if you were hoping the series continued to progress in gameplay improvements, you’ll likely be disappointed.  Still, I'd recommend it to fans of the series as well as newcomers who are looking to dip their toes into the time management genre. 

Bottom Line: Recommended for fans of the series as well as newcomers to the genre.

[code][h1]Curated by: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33004802-Chudah%27s-Corner/]Chudah's Corner[/url][/h1][/code]
